com.google.gwt.gears.localserver.client
Class LocalServer

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.gears.localserver.client.LocalServer

public class LocalServer
extends java.lang.Object

Used to manage the URLs that are served locally. A ManagedResourceStore is used to capture and manage groups of URLs that are atomically bundled together. A ResourceStore is used to capture and manage URLs individually, on an ad-hoc basis. Note that a captured URL is always served locally. That is, Gears's local server does not attempt to detect offline/online state.

Method Detail

canServeLocally

public boolean canServeLocally(java.lang.String url)
                        throws GearsException
Returns true if the URL can be served locally.

Parameters:
url - the URL to test
Returns:
true if the URL has been captured, false if not
Throws:
GearsException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the url is null

createManagedResourceStore

public ManagedResourceStore createManagedResourceStore(java.lang.String name)
                                                throws GearsException
Opens an existing ManagedResourceStore or creates a new one if no such store exists.

Parameters:
name - the user-defined name of the store
Returns:
a ManagedResourceStore
Throws:
GearsException - on any error

createManagedResourceStore

public ManagedResourceStore createManagedResourceStore(java.lang.String name,
                                                       java.lang.String requiredCookie)
                                                throws GearsException
Opens an existing ManagedResourceStore or creates a new one if no such store exists. Once the store is created, it will only serve pages if a cookie exists under the value stored in requiredCookie.

Parameters:
name - the user-defined name of the store
requiredCookie - the name of a cookie which must be present for the store to serve pages
Returns:
a ManagedResourceStore
Throws:
GearsException - on any error
